thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: Prep roundup

title: Prep roundup
text:
Posted: October 2, 2015 at 1 a.m. Brik Brauburger, former Bentonville golf standout, is shown in this picture. 
Junior High Football 
Springdale Central 14, Bentonville Black 7 
Springdale Central scored on defense and special teams to defeat Black at home Thursday. 
Connor Sikes returned a punt 30 yards for a touchdown, and Trevor Alderson added an interception return for a touchdown to pace the Warriors (5-0). 
Fayetteville Purple 20, Siloam Springs 0 
Carsten Johnson threw for a touchdown, and ran for a touchdown to lead Purple to a shutout win. 
Jacob Shaw rushed for a pair of Bulldog scores, and Noah Conklin caught a touchdown. 
Jason Ortiz added an interception for Purple (2-3). 
Bentonville Gold 40, Springdale Southwest 28 
Slade Pearson’s 64-yard touchdown catch on the first play of the second half put Gold ahead to stay at Tiger Stadium on Thursday night. 
Will Jarrett’s 2-yard touchdown run two plays into the fourth quarter stretched Gold’s lead to 33-21. 
Southwest (3-2) got back to within 33-28 with 3:54 to play, but Jarrett’s 9-yard touchdown run on Gold’s (5-0) next possession put the game out of reach. 
Southwest led 21-20 at halftime on a 14-yard touchdown pass from Grant Allen to Miller Herndon with 18 seconds left. 
College Golf 
Brauburger breaks Missouri State record 
Former Bentonville standout Brik Brauburger shot a 207 and broke Missouri State’s record over 54 holes during the Derek Dolenc Invitational. 
Brauburger, a senior, shot rounds of 68 and 69 on Monday and 70 on Tuesday for a sixth-place finish in the tournament, which was held at Gateway National Golf Club in Madison, Ill. The previous Missouri State record was 208 set by Damaso Carerra in 2008. 
Missouri State had a team score of 854 and finished fourth out of 15 teams in the tournament, just 10 strokes back of host and tournament champion Southern Illinois-Edwardsville. Belmont (849) and Tennessee-Martin (851) also finished ahead of the Bears, who finished three strokes ahead of South Dakota. 
Brauburger’s performance also earned him men’s golfer of the week honors by the Missouri Valley Conference. He currently ranks fourth in the conference with a 73.00 scoring average and has finished no worse than 14th in the Bears’ first three tournaments this fall, including a pair of top 10 finishes. 
Prep Tennis 
Rogers Heritage 7, Springdale High 2 
Singles 
1, Tony Kopek, Springdale, def. Nick Wiench, Heritage, 8-0. 
2, Spencer George, Springdale, def. Harry Cole, Heritage, 8-1. 
3, Will Zondlak, Heritage, def. Jake Marks, Springdale, 9-7. 
4, Alex Kihn, Heritage, def. Sammy Salgado, Springdale, 8-5. 
5, Nick Zonkla, Heritage, def. Garrett Story, Springdale, 8-2. 
6, Garrett Glynn, Heritage, def. Angel Lopez, Springdale, 8-1. 
Doubles 
1, W. Zondlak/Kihn, Heritage, def. Story/Marks, Springdale, 8-4. 
2, N. Zondlak/Glynn, Heritage, def.Salgado/Schroeder, Springdale, 8-6. 
3, Wiench/Cole, Heritage, def. Vopek/George, Springdale, 8-2. 
(Advertisement)
